utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, if no-one else will say it, I will. We really suck at paintball.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That was absolutely humiliating.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, some battles you win, some battles you lose.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, but you don’t have to lose to Kyle Bernstein’s Bar-Mitzvah party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think we have to acknowledge, those were some fairly savage pre-adolescent Jews.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, we were annihilated by our own incompetence and the inability of some people to follow the chain of command.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, let it go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I want to talk about the fact that Wolowitz shot me in the back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I shot you for good reason, you were leading us into disaster.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was giving clear, concise orders.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You hid behind a tree yelling “get the kid in the yarmulkah, get the kid in the yarmulkah.”

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving)
utterance.content: Oh, hey guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello Penny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Morning ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, how was paintball, did you have fun?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sure, if you consider being fragged by your own troops fun. You clear space on your calendar, there will be an enquiry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, um, oh hey, I’m having a party on Saturday so if you guys are around you should come by.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A party?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A boy-girl party?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, there will be boys, and there will be girls, and it is a party. So, it’ll just be a bunch of my friends, we’ll have some beer, do a little dancing…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dancing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t know, Penny…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The thing is, we’re not….

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re really more….

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But thanks, thanks for thinking of us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you sure? Come on, it’s Halloween.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A Halloween party?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: As in, costumes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is there a theme?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, yeah, Halloween.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but are the costumes random, or genre specific?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: As usual, I’m not following.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s asking if we can come as anyone from science-fiction, fantasy…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What about comic-books?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Anime?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: TV , film, D_D, Manga, Greek Gods, Roman Gods, Norse Gods…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Anything you want, okay? Any costume you want. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gentlemen, to the sewing machines.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: Howard (Entering at speed, also wearing a Flash costume)
utterance.content: Bjow

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh no!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Make way for the fastest man alive. Oh no!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, this is why I wanted to have a costume meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We all have other costumes, we can change.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Or, we could walk right behind each other all night and look like one person going really fast.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, no, no, it’s a boy-girl party, this Flash runs solo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, how about this, nobody gets to be The Flash, we all change, agreed?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Agreed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I call Frodo!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Damn!

utterance.speaker: Raj (Entering dressed as Thor)
utterance.content: Hey. Sorry I’m late, but my hammer got stuck in the door on the bus.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You went with Thor?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? Just because I’m Indian I can’t be a Norse God? No, no, no, Raj has to be an Indian God. That’s racism. I mean, look at Wolowitz, he’s not English, but he’s dressed like Peter Pan. Sheldon is neither sound nor light, but he’s obviously the Doppler Effect.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not Peter Pan, I’m Robin Hood.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really, because I saw Peter Pan, and you’re dressed exactly like Cathy Rigby. She was a little bigger than you, but it’s basically the same look, man.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, there’s something I want to talk to you about before we go to the party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t care if anybody gets it, I’m going as the Doppler Effect.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s not…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I have to, I can demonstrate. Neeeeoooowwwww!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Terrific. Um, this party is my first chance for Penny to see me in the context of her social group, and I need you not to embarrass me tonight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, what exactly do you mean by embarrass you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: For example, tonight no-one needs to know that my middle name is Leakey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, there’s nothing embarrassing about that, your father worked with Lewis Leakey, a great anthropologist. It had nothing to do with your bed-wetting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All I’m saying is that this party is the perfect opportunity for Penny to see me as a member of her peer group. A potential close friend and… perhaps more. I don’t want to look like a dork.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just a heads up fellas, if anyone gets lucky I’ve got a dozen condoms in my quiver.

utterance.speaker: Penny (opening door, not in costume)
utterance.content: Oh, hey guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, sorry we’re late.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Late? It’s 7:05.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you said the party starts at seven.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, yeah, when you start a party at seven, no-one shows up at, you know, seven.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. Yes it is. Okay, well, um, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What, are all the girls in the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Probably, but in their own homes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So what time does the costume parade start?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The parade?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, so the judges can give out the prizes for best costume, you know, most frightening, most authentic, most accurate visual representation of a scientific principle.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, I’m sorry but there aren’t going to be any parades or judges or prizes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This party is just going to suck.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, come on, it’s going to be fun, and you all look great, I mean, look at you, Thor, and, oh, Peter Pan, that’s so cute.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, Penny, he’s Rob…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m Peter Pan! And I’ve got a handful of pixie dust with your name on it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No you don’t. Oh, hey, what’s Sheldon supposed to be.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, he’s the Doppler Effect.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. It’s the apparent change in the frequency of a wave caused by relative motion between the source of the wave and the observer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sure, I see it now, the Doppler Effect. Alright, I’ve got to shower, you guys um, make yourselves comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, people get it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mmmm, by Odin’s beard, this is good Chex Mix.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No thanks, peanuts, I can’t afford to swell up in these tights.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m confused. If there’s no costume parade, what are we doing here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re socialising. Meeting new people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Telepathically?

utterance.speaker: Penny (crossing the room in a cat costume, speaking to someone off-screen)
utterance.content: Oh hey, when did you get here, Hi!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Penny is wearing the worst Catwoman costume I have ever seen, and that includes Halle Berry’s.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s not Catwoman, she’s just a generic cat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And that’s the kind of sloppy costuming which results from a lack of rules and competition.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey guys, check out the sexy nurse. I believe it’s time for me to turn my head and cough.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is your move?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m going to use the mirror technique. She brushes her hair back, I brush my hair back, she shrugs, I shrug, subconsciously she’s thinking we’re in sync, we belong together.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where do you get this stuff?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, psychology journals, internet research, and there’s this great show on VH1 about how to pick up girls.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, if only I had his confidence. I have such difficulty speaking to women. Or around women. Or at times, even effeminate men.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If that’s a working stethoscope, maybe you’d like to hear my heart skip a beat.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Costume Girl
utterance.content: No thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, seriously, you can, I have transient idiopathic arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I want to get to know Penny’s friends, I just, I don’t know how to talk to these people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I actually might be able to help.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Like Jane Goodall observing the apes, I initially saw their interactions as confusing and unstructured, but patterns emerge, they have their own language if you will.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it seems that the newcomer approaches the existing group with the greeting “How wasted am I?” which is met with an approving chorus of “Dude.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then what happens?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s as far as I’ve gotten.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is ridiculous, I’m jumping in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, you’re coming with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I hardly think so.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aren’t you afraid I’ll embarrass you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes. But I need a wing-man.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alright, but if we’re going to use flight metaphors I’m much more suited to being the guy from the FAA, analysing wreckage.

utterance.speaker: Girl in Hippie Costume
utterance.content: Oh, Hi!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: So, what are you supposed to be?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Me? I’ll give you a hint. Neeeeooooowwwww!

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Uh, a choo-choo train?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Close! Neeeeeoooooowwwww!

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: A brain damaged choo-choo train?

utterance.speaker: Girl in Butterfly Costume (dropping onto sofa next to Raj)
utterance.content: How wasted am I?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Neeeeeooooowwwwww!

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I still don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m the Doppler Effect.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Okay, if that is some sort of learning disability, I think it’s very insensitive.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why don’t you just tell people you’re a zebra?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, why don’t you just tell people you’re one of the seven dwarves.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because I’m Frodo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, well, I’m the Doppler Effect.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s Penny’s ex-boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you suppose he’s doing here? Besides disrupting the local gravity field.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If he were any bigger, he’d have moons orbiting him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, snap. So I guess we’ll be leaving now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why should we leave? For all we know, he crashed the party and Penny doesn’t even want him here. .

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You have a back-up hypothesis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe they just want to be friends.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or maybe she wants to be friends, and he wants something more.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then he and I are on equal ground.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but you’re much closer to it than he is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, if this was 15,000 years ago, by virtue of his size and strength, Kurt would be entitled to his choice of female partners.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And male partners. Animal partners. Large primordial eggplants, pretty much whatever tickled his fancy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, but our society has undergone a paradigm shift, in the information age, Sheldon, you and I are the alpha males. We shouldn’t have to back down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: True. Why don’t you text him that and see if he backs down?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. I’m going to assert my dominance face to face.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Face to face? Are you going to wait for him to sit down, or are you going to stand on a coffee table?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello Penny. Hello Kurt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey guys. You having a good time?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Given the reaction to my costume, this party is a scathing indictment of the American education system.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: What, you’re a zebra, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yet another child left behind.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: And what are you supposed to be, an Elf?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I’m a Hobbit.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, a Hobbit is a mortal Halfling inhabitant of Middle Earth, whereas an Elf is an immortal tall warrior.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: So why the hell would you want to be a Hobbit?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because he is neither tall nor immortal, and none of us could be The Flash.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Well, whatever, why don’t you go hop off on a quest, I’m talking to Penny here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think we’re all talking to Penny here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not. No offence.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Okay, maybe you didn’t hear me, go away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alright Kurt, be nice.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Aw, I am being nice. Right little buddy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Kurt!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I understand your impulse to try to physically intimidate me. I mean, you can’t compete with me on an intellectual level and so you’re driven to animalistic puffery.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Are you calling me a puffy animal?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course not, no, he’s not, you’re not, right Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I said animalistic. Of course we’re all animals, but some of us have climbed a little higher on the evolutionary tree.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If he understands that, you’re in trouble.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: So what, I’m unevolved?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re in trouble.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: You know, you use a lot of big words for such a little dwarf.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Kurt, please.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, Penny, it’s okay, I can handle this. I’m not a dwarf, I’m a Hobbit. A Hobbit. Are misfiring neurons in your hippocampus preventing the conversion from short-term to long-term memory?

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Okay, now you’re starting to make me mad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A homo-habilus discovering his opposable thumbs says what?

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think I’ve made my point.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Yeah, how about I make a point out of your pointy little head.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let me remind you, while my moral support is absolute, in a physical confrontation I will be less than useless.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s not going to be a confrontation, in fact I doubt if he can even spell confrontation.

utterance.speaker: Kurt (physically lifting Leonard from the ground)
utterance.content: C – O – N… frontation!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Kurt, put him down this instant.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: He started it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t care, I’m finishing it, put him down.

utterance.speaker: Kurt
utterance.content: Fine. You’re one lucky little leprechaun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s a Hobbit! I’ve got your back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, are you okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, no, I’m fine. It’s good, it’s a good party, thanks for having us, it’s just getting a little late so….

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay, alright, well thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Happy Halloween. If it’s any consolation, I thought that homo-habilus line really put him in his place.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tea. When people are upset the cultural convention is to bring them hot beverages. There there. You want to talk about it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. There there was really all I had.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good night Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny (knocking on door and entering)
utterance.content: Hey Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I just wanted to make sure you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m so sorry about what happened.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes it is. That’s why I broke up with him, he always does stuff like that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So why was he at your party?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I ran into him last week and, he was… just, all apologetic, about how he’s changed, he was just going on and on and I believed him, and I’m an idiot because I always believe guys like that and… I can’t go back to my party because he’s there, and I know you don’t want to hear this and I’m upset and I’m really drunk and I just want to…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: God, what is wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing, you’re perfect.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Gah, I’m not perfect.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes you are.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You really think so, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How much have you had to drink tonight?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just…. a lot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you sure that your being drunk, and your being angry with Kurt doesn’t have something to do with what’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It might. Boy, you’re really smart.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m a frickin’ genius.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, you are so great. Why can’t all guys be like you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because if all guys were like me, the human race couldn’t survive.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I should probably go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Probably.

utterance.speaker: Penny (in doorway)
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s right, you saw what you saw. That’s how we roll in The Shire.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Coming.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, have you seen Koothrapali?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s not here. Maybe the Avenger summoned him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s not the Marvel comic story, he’s the original Norse God.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you for the clarification.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m supposed to give him a ride home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well I’m sure he’ll be fine. He has his hammer.

utterance.speaker: Butterfly Girl
utterance.content: Wow, I have to say, you are an amazing man. You’re gentle and passionate, and my God, you are such a good listener!
